intro: Elaeagia glomiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, which are a distinctive feature. Its leaves are usually broad and oval, with a rough texture. Elaeagia glomiflora is adapted to withstand drought and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
